discourse_list.title: Comparison of DAI with the Danish Krone

content.content: There are quite a few similarities - I’m sure many of you have thought about this before but still may be of interest: The Beauty of the Danish Krone - by Ronan McGovern I know there’s the idea that some day DAI might free float. Instead, or perhaps in the meantime, the Danish Krone (where you just change what you’re pegged to) is a model worth having in mind. It’s non-obvious to me what DAI would be if it’s in complete free-float. Eth free floating makes some sense because it’s effectively taking a cut - via base fee burns - of the underlying Ethereum economy. I’m not against DAI free floating but I’d want to have a better mental model for what that is (something like RAI? that’s pretty hard to understand…)
